Count rows by quadrat-index.

Source: R/abund_index.R

Count rows by quadrat-index. This is a conservative wrapper around the function abundanceperquad() of the CTFSRPackage. Its output is always abundance (not basal area nor agb) and includes all available rows. If you want to exclude trees of some particular dbh range you need to do it before using this function.

abund_index(censdata, plotdim, gridsize)

Arguments

censdata

A table of plot census data.
plotdim

The x and y dimensions of the plot.
gridsize

Side of the square quadrate.

Value

A dataframe where each quadrat-index is a column and each species is a rowname.

See also

fgeo.tool::add_index().

Examples

cns <- luquillo_tree6_random
pdm <- c(1000, 500)
gsz <- 20
abund_index(cns, pdm, gsz)
